newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Oct 21-31 IGP-M index 0.11 pct.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Oct 21-31 IGP-M index 0.11 pct.

text.p: Brazilian inflation October 21-31 rose to 0.11 percent, against a 0.07 percent rise September 21-30, as measured by the IGP-M index released by the Getulio Vargas Foundation (FGV).

The IGP-M is composed of three economic indicators: The IPA wholesale price index rose 0.14 percent in the October 21-31 period, the IPC consumer price index gained 0.02 percent, and the INCC national index of construction costs advanced 0.25 percent.
The IPA has a 60 percent weighting in the IGP-M, the IPC a 30 percent weighting and the INCC 10 percent, the FGV said.
The IGP-M index measures inflation over 10-day intervals. The FGV is an independent research institute.
